intro: Notopleura chapensis, commonly known as the New Zealand flax, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Pandanaceae and is characterized by its tall, slender stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically green or white in color. Notopleura chapensis is often found in coastal and lowland areas, thriving in well-drained soils. It has been used traditionally by Māori for its strong, fibrous leaves, which were used to make clothing and other crafts.
